event: On 4 September 2016, Mother Teresa was canonised by the Catholic Church as Saint Teresa of Calcutta.
Name: Mother Teresa

event: Mother Teresa was born on 26 August 1910 into a Kosovar Albanian family in Skopje, Ottoman Empire (now the capital of North Macedonia).
Name: Mother Teresa

event: Mother Teresa's North Macedoniadied in 1919 when Mother Teresa was eight years old.
Name: Mother Teresa

event: Mother Teresa's resolve strengthened on 15 August 1928 as Mother Teresa prayed at the shrine of the Black Madonna of Vitina-Letnice, where Mother Teresa often went on pilgrimages.[0
Name: Mother Teresa

event: Mother Teresa took Mother Teresa's first religious vows on 24 May 1931.
Name: Mother Teresa

event: Mother Teresa served there for nearly twenty years and was appointed the Loreto convent school in Entally, eastern Calcutta's headmistress in 1944.
Name: Mother Teresa

event: At the beginning of 1949, Mother Teresa was joined in Mother Teresa's effort by a group of young women, and Mother Teresa laid the foundation for a new religious community helping the "poorest among the poor".[0
Name: Mother Teresa

event: Mother Teresa visited Armenia after the 1988 earthquake and met with Soviet Premier Nikolai Ryzhkov.Mother Teresa
Name: Mother Teresa

event: Mother Teresa received the Ramon Magsaysay Award for Peace and International Understanding, given for work in South or East Asia, in 1962.
Name: Mother Teresa

event: By the early 1970s, Mother Teresa was an international celebrity. Mother Teresa had been catapulted to fame via Malcolm Muggeridge's's 1969 BBC documentary, Something Beautiful for God, before Malcolm Muggeridge's released a 1971 book of the same name.
Name: Mother Teresa

event: Mother Teresa received the Pacem in Terris Award in 1976.
Name: Mother Teresa

event: In August 1987, Mother Teresa received an honorary doctor of social science degree from the University of Scranton in northeastern Pennsylvania, where she received the La Storta Medal for Human Service from university president William J. Byron in recognition of Mother Teresa's service and Mother Teresa's ministry to help the destitute and sick.
Name: Mother Teresa

event: In 1979, Mother Teresa received the Ramon Magsaysay Award for Peace and International Understanding, given for work in South or East Asia, "for work undertaken in the struggle to overcome poverty and distress, which also constitutes a threat to peace".
Name: Mother Teresa

event: After Pope Pius XII's's death in 1958, Mother Teresa was praying for Pope Pius XII's at a requiem mass when Mother Teresa was relieved of "the long darkness: that strange suffering."
Name: Mother Teresa

event: Mother Teresa was beatified on 19 October 2003, and was known by Catholics as "Blessed".
Name: Mother Teresa

event: On 4 September 2017, during a celebration honouring the 1st anniversary of Mother Teresa's canonisation, Sister Mary Prema Pierick, Superior-General of the Missionaries of Charity, announced that Mother Teresa would be made the co-patron of the Calcutta Archdiocese during a Mass in the Cathedral of the Most Holy Rosary on 6 September 2017.
Name: Mother Teresa

event: On 5 September 2017, Archbishop Thomas D'Souza, who serves as head of the Calcutta Archdiocese, confirmed that Mother Teresa would be named co-patron of the Calcutta Diocese, alongside Francis Xavier.
Name: Mother Teresa

event: In 2012, Mother Teresa was ranked number 5 in Outlook India's poll of the Greatest Indian.
